title: The 1300HP Grenade
description: 1986 was the peak of F1 insanity. The BMW and Renault engines pushed 5.5 bar of boost in qualifying. Senna's pole lap here is considered one of the most physically demanding laps ever driven.

keyMoments: Nigel Mansell's spectacular tire blowout at 180mph that cost him the title
Senna's pole position: 1:15.654, wrestling the car with one hand on the shifter
The 'Qualifying Engines' that would be scrapped after just 3 laps
Prost winning the title by stealth while the others destroyed their tires
raceContext.significance: This was the end of the 'Wild West' turbo era. The Lotus 98T had no traction control, manual shifting, and turbo lag that hit like a sledgehammer. Driving this car at the limit is the ultimate test of throttle control.
